page.title:
Run IIb Philosophy
Run IIb Philosophy
page.enlisting:
⬧ Run IIb upgrade + commissioning, operations, data analysis, physics • Collaboration, Project Management have been designing Run IIb project with full awareness of tight constraints ◆ Abbreviated time scales make for unique situation in HEP ◆ Collaboration is, and will be, multi-tasking • Have sought to limit scope, complexity wherever possible, value engineering concepts applied during all phases of design ◆ Exploit existing designs, systems, experience ◆ Effort to find alternatives to designs that require broad replacements ◆ Carefully crafting sub-projects, assignments, & responsibilities ◆ Target high-pT program exclusively ◆ Some examples: • D-Zero Run IIb project scope & total cost essentially unchanged ⬧ Run IIb upgrade + commissioning, operations, data analysis, physics
⬧ Run IIb upgrade + commissioning, operations, data analysis, physics ⬧ R u n

page.title:
Run IIb Design Guidelines
Run IIb Design Guidelines
page.enlisting:
1-2 2-5 • Run IIb: increase in instantaneous, integrated luminosity relative to • Silicon: • Trigger: ◆ Current detector designed for ~ 2 fb-1, evidence that it will survive to 4-5 fb-1 ◆ After study of various options, have chosen to pursue full silicon replacement ◆ Increase in luminosity results in unacceptable increase in rates - occupancies, ◆ Move rejection upstream in readout stream (contain dead time), maintain both ◆ Address need for higher-bandwidth data logging ⬧ The most appropriate radiation-hard technology used at that time ⬧ Partial replacement not viable: unacceptable level of technical risk, more down-time 1-2 2-5 1-2

page.title:
Subproject Overviews
Subproject Overviews
page.enlisting:
• WBS 1.1: Silicon Detector • WBS 1.2: Trigger Systems ◆ Replace with more radiation-hard version, improved b-tagging capability ◆ Level 1: Shift some trigger functionality upstream to hardware level ◆ Level 2: Incremental upgrades to Run IIa systems • WBS 1.3: DAQ/Online System • WBS 1.4: Project Administration ◆ Project personnel, travel, miscellaneous supplies • WBS 1.5: Installation ◆ Address need for enhanced filtering capability, higher bandwidth data ◆ Integration of silicon, trigger installation & pre-beam commissioning ⬧ WBS 1.2.1, L1 Calorimeter Trigger ⬧ WBS 1.2.2, L1 Calorimeter/Track Match ⬧ WBS 1.2.3, L1 Central Track Trigger ⬧ WBS 1.2.4, L2 Beta System ⬧ WBS 1.2.5, L2 Silicon Track Trigger • WBS 1.1: Silicon Detector • WBS 1.2: Trigger Systems ◆ Replace with more radiation-hard version, improved b-tagging capability ◆ Level 1: Shift some trigger functionality upstream to hardware level ◆ Level 2: Incremental upgrades to Run IIa systems • WBS 1.3: DAQ/Online System • WBS 1.4: Project Administration ◆ Project personnel, travel, miscellaneous supplies • WBS 1.5: Installation ◆ Address need for enhanced filtering capability, higher bandwidth data ◆ Integration of silicon, trigger installation & pre-beam commissioning • WBS 1.1: Silicon Detector

page.title:
WBS 1.1: Basic Silicon Design Choices
WBS 1.1:
Basic Silicon Design Choices

picture.caption: DOE EIR of Run IIb Nov 4-8, 2002
picture.name: Image74

page.enlisting:
⬧ Axial readout only ⬧ Mounted on integrated support ⬧ Assembled into one unit ⬧ Designed for Vbias up to 700 V • Six layer silicon tracker, divided into two radial regions ◆ Inner layers: Layers 0 and 1 ◆ Outer layers: Layers 2-5 ⬧ Axial and stereo readout ⬧ Stave support structure ⬧ Designed for Vbias up to 300 V • Employ single sided silicon only, 3 sensor types ◆ 2-chip wide for Layer 0 ◆ 3-chip wide for Layer 1 ◆ 5-chip wide for Layers 2-5 • No element supported from beampipe ⬧ Axial readout only ⬧ Mounted on integrated support ⬧ Assembled into one unit ⬧ Designed for Vbias up to 700 V

page.title:
Past Run IIb Milestones, Reviews
Past Run IIb Milestones, Reviews
page.enlisting:
• April/Nov 00: Initial presentations of Run IIb plans to PAC • June 01: D-Zero Trigger Task Force put in place to clarify • Nov 01: Silicon TDR and Trigger/Online CDR presented to PAC • Dec 01: Director’s Technical Review of CDF and D-Zero Run IIb ◆ Chair: E. Temple • April 02: Director’s Review of Run IIb Upgrade Projects • June 02: Aspen PAC recommends Stage I approval • Aug 12-15 ‘02: Director’s Review of Run IIb Upgrade Projects ◆ Co-chairs: E. Temple, J. Pilcher ◆ Silicon sub-project “well developed”, design “clearly mature” ◆ All five trigger sub-projects deemed “ready for baselining” ◆ Project preparedness, quality & depth of staffing noted • Sep 24-26 ‘02: DOE (Lehman) Review ◆ “DOE should move forward expeditiously with CD-1, CD-2, CD-3a” • April/Nov 00: Initial presentations of Run IIb plans to PAC • June 01: D-Zero Trigger Task Force put in place to clarify

Run IIb Trigger Task Force
page.enlisting:
* = Sub-Group Chair
* = Sub-Group Chair DOE EIR of Run IIb Nov 4-8, 2002
DOE EIR of Run IIb
Nov 4-8, 2002

• Run IIb Trigger Task Force in place 6/25/01: • Co-Chairs: M. Hildreth (Notre Dame), R. Partridge (Brown U) • Charge: investigate triggering in high-rate environment • Provided starting point, basis for all proposed Run IIb trigger • Calorimeter ◆ M. Abolins (MSU) ◆ D.
